column4: Hello, i was wondering if someone might have time to help me with a wireless setup issue
state ur problem bud
this is ubuntu we're talking about... there's built in wifi applications
bingo.... use the wifi app
u have X11 ?
do u have any desktop installed?
wicd-ncurses install
thats the easiest way
it installed a wicd-ncurses app that helps u configure ur wireless card
doesnt get any easier than that for the command line

or u can set it up manually ... check out http://www.linuxjournal.com/content/wi-fi-command-line?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+linuxjournalcom+%28Linux+Journal+-+The+Original+Magazine+of+the+Linux+Community%29
no prob
good luck... and may the force be with u
at terminal type "apt-cache search wicd"
i'm not at a terminal now.. but that will give u the precise name to install
yes... if u install just wicd.. it should come with wicd-ncurses
then from terminal run ... wicd-ncurses after install
u good ?
lol sorry yes.. that
lol..... ok
reminds me of what this girl once told me the next morning :)
noo prob brotha... we are all here to help
